support_summary: DYNC1H1 (Dynein) physically binds ATXN3 to regulate intracellular transport (Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Microtubule-based transport of misfolded protein cargo toward the cell body.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 acts as an adapter that links polyubiquitinated misfolded proteins to the dynein motor complex for sequestration into aggresomes.
biological_consequence: Misfolded proteins → ATXN3/HDAC6/Dynein complex formation → Loading of ubiquitinated cargo onto Dynein motor → Retrograde microtubule transport → Aggresome formation at the MTOC → Cytoprotective sequestration of toxic aggregates.
specific_effects: Directly binds the Dynein Intermediate Chain (DIC)
Promotes the concentration of misfolded proteins (e.g., CFTRΔF508) at the microtubule organizing center (MTOC)
Aggresome formation is abolished by ATXN3 active-site (C14A) or UIM mutations

evidence.paper_title: The polyglutamine neurodegenerative protein ataxin-3 regulates aggresome formation
evidence.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences (PNAS)
evidence.relevant_quote: Endogenous AT3 associates with dynein and HDAC6... siRNA knockdown of AT3 greatly reduces aggresomes formed by CFTRΔF508, demonstrating a critical role of AT3 in this process... These data indicate that the deubiquitylating activity of AT3 and its ubiquitin interacting motifs as well play essential roles in CFTRΔF508 aggresome formation.

mechanism_correction: ATXN3 interacts with the dynein motor complex (specifically the Dynein Intermediate Chain, DIC) and HDAC6 to facilitate the retrograde transport of misfolded proteins. This interaction is not merely binding; ATXN3's deubiquitinating activity and UIMs are essential for linking polyubiquitinated cargo to the dynein-dynactin transport machinery for aggresome formation at the MTOC.
mechanism: Microtubule-based transport of misfolded protein cargo toward the cell body.
effect: ATXN3 acts as an adapter that links polyubiquitinated misfolded proteins to the dynein motor complex for sequestration into aggresomes.
summary: ATXN3 activates DYNC1H1 to modulate retrograde axonal transport & aggresome formation, ultimately affecting cytoprotective sequestration of toxic aggregates.
